public ref class Parallel abstract sealed

summary.span: 提供平行迴圈和區域的支援。

span.span: Provides support for parallel loops and regions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 類別提供一般作業，例如迴圈，針對每個迴圈，和一組陳述式執行的程式庫為基礎的資料平行取代。The class provides library-based data parallel replacements for common operations such as for loops, for each loops, and execution of a set of statements. ## Examples 此範例示範數種方法來實作平行迴圈使用多個語言建構。This example demonstrates several approaches to implementing a parallel loop using multiple language constructs. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Parallel#07](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.parallel/cs/parallelintro.cs#07)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Parallel#07](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.parallel/vb/parallelintro.vb#07)]

threadsafe.span: 所有 public 和 protected 成員是安全執行緒，且可能會從多個執行緒同時使用。

span.span: All public and protected members of are thread-safe and may be used concurrently from multiple threads.

related.span: 資料平行處理原則 (工作平行程式庫)

span.span: Data Parallelism (Task Parallel Library)

related.span: 使用.NET Framework 進行平行程式設計的範例

span.span: Samples for Parallel Programming with the .NET Framework

summary.span: 執行 (在 Visual Basic 中為 ) 迴圈，其中可以平行執行反覆項目，還可以監控和操作迴圈的狀態。

span.span: Executes a ( in Visual Basic) loop in which iterations may run in parallel and the state of the loop can be monitored and manipulated.

returns.span: 包含迴圈已完成部分之相關資訊的的結構。

span.span: A structure that contains information about which portion of the loop completed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`叫用委派一次反覆項目範圍中每個值 (`fromInclusive`， `toExclusive`)。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each value in the iteration range (`fromInclusive`, `toExclusive`). 這會提供兩個引數：It is provided with two arguments: - 表示反覆項目計數的值。An value that represents the iteration count. - A可用來提早脫離迴圈的執行個體。A instance that can be used to break out of the loop prematurely. 編譯器所建立物件; 無法在使用者程式碼中執行個體化。The object is created by the compiler; it cannot be instantiated in user code. 呼叫方法會通知`for`之後目前的反覆項目沒有要執行的作業。Calling the method informs the `for` operation that iterations after the current one don't have to execute. 但目前所有的反覆項目將仍然有一個要執行，如果它們還沒有這麼做。However, all iterations before the current one will still have to be executed if they haven't already. 因此，呼叫類似於使用符號內的作業傳統`for`迴圈的語言如 C# 中，但不是完美的替代： 例如，則之後目前的反覆項目絕對不會不保證執行。Therefore, calling is similar to using a break operation within a conventional `for` loop in a language like C#, but it is not a perfect substitute: For example, there is no guarantee that iterations after the current one will definitely not execute. 如果目前不需要之前，請執行所有的反覆項目，使用方法，而不是使用。If executing all iterations before the current one is not necessary, use the method instead of using . 呼叫會通知`for`迴圈，它可能會放棄所有剩餘反覆項目，不論它們位之前或之後的目前反覆項目，因為所有所需的工作將已經完成。Calling informs the `for` loop that it may abandon all remaining iterations, regardless of whether they're before or after the current iteration, because all required work will have already been completed. 不過，隨著使用，不有哪些其他反覆項目將不會執行任何保證。However, as with , there are no guarantees regarding which other iterations will not execute. 如果迴圈已提前結束，傳回的結構將會包含迴圈的完成的相關資訊。If a loop is ended prematurely, the structure that is returned will contain relevant information about the loop's completion. 如果`fromInclusive`大於或等於`toExclusive`，方法會立即傳回而不執行任何反覆項目。If `fromInclusive` is greater than or equal to `toExclusive`, the method returns immediately without performing any iterations. ## Examples 下列範例會以平行方式執行迴圈的最多 100 個反覆項目。The following example executes up to 100 iterations of a loop in parallel. 從 1 到 1000 毫秒之間的隨機間隔就會暫停每個反覆項目。Each iteration pauses for a random interval from 1 to 1,000 milliseconds. 隨機產生的值會決定迴圈的反覆項目上呼叫方法。A randomly generated value determines on which iteration of the loop the method is called. 如輸出所範例所示，其索引大於任何反覆項目呼叫後面的屬性值開始方法。As the output from the example shows, no iterations whose index is greater than the property value start after the call to the method. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.ParallelLoopState#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.parallelloopstate/cs/break1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.ParallelLoopState#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.parallelloopstate/vb/break1.vb#2)] 因為迴圈的反覆項目仍可能同時執行的時機呼叫方法，每個反覆項目會呼叫屬性，以檢查是否已呼叫另一個反覆項目方法。Because iterations of the loop are still likely to be executing when the method is called, each iteration calls the property to check whether another iteration has called the method. 屬性值是否`true`，在反覆項目值檢查屬性以及其是否大於目前的反覆項目的索引值，會立即傳回。If the property value is `true`, the iteration checks the value of the property and, if it is greater than the current iteration's index value, returns immediately.

summary.span: 使用執行緒區域資料執行 (在 Visual Basic 中為 ) 迴圈，其中可以平行執行反覆項目，還可以監控和操作迴圈的狀態。

returns.span: 包含迴圈已完成部分之相關資訊的的結構。

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`叫用委派一次反覆項目範圍中每個值 (`fromInclusive`， `toExclusive`)。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each value in the iteration range (`fromInclusive`, `toExclusive`). 這提供下列參數： 反覆項目計數 ()、可用來提前結束，脫離迴圈的執行個體，且可能在相同執行緒執行的反覆項目之間共用某些本機狀態。It is provided with the following parameters: the iteration count (), a instance that may be used to break out of the loop prematurely, and some local state that may be shared amongst iterations that execute on the same thread. `localInit`叫用委派一次參與迴圈的執行，並傳回每個這些工作的初始本機狀態每項工作。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each task that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those tasks. 這些初始狀態會傳遞至第一個`body`上每個工作引動過程。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each task. 然後，每個後續的內文引動過程傳回可能已修改的狀態值傳遞至下一個主體引動過程。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最後，每個工作上上次的主體引動過程會傳回傳遞至狀態值`localFinally`委派。Finally, the last body invocation on each task returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. `localFinally`叫用委派一次每個工作，每個工作的本機狀態執行最終動作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per task to perform a final action on each task's local state. 這個委派可能會同時叫用多個工作;因此，您必須同步處理任何共用變數的存取權。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple tasks; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 方法可能會使用更多的工作，比執行緒存留時間內執行，為現有的工作完成，並由新的工作所取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 這可讓基礎物件有機會新增、 變更或移除服務迴圈的執行緒。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop. 如果`fromInclusive`大於或等於`toExclusive`，則方法會立即傳回而不執行任何反覆項目。If `fromInclusive` is greater than or equal to `toExclusive`, then the method returns immediately without performing any iterations. 如需使用這個方法的範例，請參閱 < [ 如何： 撰寫含有執行緒區域變數的 Parallel.For 迴圈](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-write-a-parallel-for-loop-with-thread-local-variables.md)。For an example that uses this method, see [How to: Write a Parallel.For Loop with Thread-Local Variables](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-write-a-parallel-for-loop-with-thread-local-variables.md).

summary.span: 使用 64 位元索引和執行緒區域資料執行 (在 Visual Basic 中為 ) 迴圈，其中可以平行執行反覆項目、可以設定迴圈選項，還可以監控和操作迴圈的狀態。

span.span: Executes a ( in Visual Basic) loop with 64-bit indexes and thread-local data in which iterations may run in parallel, loop options can be configured, and the state of the loop can be monitored and manipulated.

returns.span: 包含迴圈已完成部分之相關資訊的的結構。

span.span: A structure that contains information about which portion of the loop completed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`叫用委派一次反覆項目範圍中每個值 (`fromInclusive`， `toExclusive`)。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each value in the iteration range (`fromInclusive`, `toExclusive`). 這提供下列參數： 反覆項目計數 ()、可用來提前結束，脫離迴圈的執行個體，且可能在相同執行緒執行的反覆項目之間共用某些本機狀態。It is provided with the following parameters: the iteration count (), a instance that may be used to break out of the loop prematurely, and some local state that may be shared amongst iterations that execute on the same thread. `localInit`叫用委派一次的每個執行緒都參與迴圈的執行，並傳回每個執行緒的初始本機狀態。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each thread that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those threads. 這些初始狀態會傳遞至第一個`body`引動過程上每個執行緒。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each thread. 然後，每個後續的內文引動過程傳回可能已修改的狀態值傳遞至下一個主體引動過程。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最後，在每個執行緒上的最後一個主體引動過程會傳回狀態的值傳遞至`localFinally`委派。Finally, the last body invocation on each thread returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. `localFinally`叫用委派一次每個執行緒上每個執行緒的本機狀態執行最終動作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per thread to perform a final action on each thread's local state. 這個委派可能會同時叫用上多個執行緒;因此，您必須同步處理任何共用變數的存取權。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple threads; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 方法可能會使用更多的工作，比執行緒存留時間內執行，為現有的工作完成，並由新的工作所取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 這可讓基礎物件有機會新增、 變更或移除服務迴圈的執行緒。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop. 如果`fromInclusive`大於或等於`toExclusive`，則方法會立即傳回而不執行任何反覆項目。If `fromInclusive` is greater than or equal to `toExclusive`, then the method returns immediately without performing any iterations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 提供此多載的情況下，您要覆寫預設的資料分割配置。This overload is provided for scenarios where you want to override the default partitioning scheme. 例如，小型迴圈主體可能受益於資料分割的範圍。For example, small loop bodies might benefit from partitioning the range. 方法必須要有支援動態磁碟分割的自訂 partitioner。The method expects custom partitioners to support dynamic partitioning. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 < [PLINQ 和 TPL 的自訂 Partitioner](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md)並[如何： 實作動態磁碟分割](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-implement-dynamic-partitions.md)。For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md) and [How to: Implement Dynamic Partitions](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-implement-dynamic-partitions.md). `localInit`叫用委派一次參與迴圈的執行，並傳回每個這些工作的初始本機狀態每項工作。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each task that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those tasks. 這些初始狀態會傳遞至第一個`body`上每個工作引動過程。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each task. 然後，每個後續的內文引動過程傳回可能已修改的狀態值傳遞至下一個主體引動過程。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最後，每個工作上上次的主體引動過程會傳回傳遞至狀態值`localFinally`委派。Finally, the last body invocation on each task returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. `localFinally`叫用委派一次每個工作，每個工作的本機狀態執行最終動作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per task to perform a final action on each task's local state. 這個委派可能會同時叫用多個工作;因此，您必須同步處理任何共用變數的存取權。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple tasks; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 方法可能會使用更多的工作，比執行緒存留時間內執行，為現有的工作完成，並由新的工作所取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 這可讓基礎物件有機會新增、 變更或移除服務迴圈的執行緒。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`叫用委派一次中每個元素`source`可列舉。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each element in the `source` enumerable. 這提供下列參數： 目前的項目，可用來提早脫離迴圈的執行個體]、 [目前項目的索引 ()，和一些可能會在執行的反覆項目之間共用的本機狀態在同一執行緒中。It is provided with the following parameters: the current element, a instance that may be used to break out of the loop prematurely, the current element's index (), and some local state that may be shared amongst iterations that execute on the same thread. `localInit`叫用委派一次參與迴圈的執行，並傳回每個這些工作的初始本機狀態每項工作。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each task that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those tasks. 這些初始狀態會傳遞至第一個`body`上每個工作引動過程。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each task. 然後，每個後續的內文引動過程傳回可能已修改的狀態值傳遞至下一個主體引動過程。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最後，每個工作上上次的主體引動過程會傳回傳遞至狀態值`localFinally`委派。Finally, the last body invocation on each task returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. `localFinally`叫用委派一次每個工作，每個工作的本機狀態執行最終動作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per task to perform a final action on each task’s local state. 這個委派可能會同時叫用多個工作;因此，您必須同步處理任何共用變數的存取權。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple tasks; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 方法可能會使用更多的工作，比執行緒存留時間內執行，為現有的工作完成，並由新的工作所取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 這可讓基礎物件有機會新增、 變更或移除服務迴圈的執行緒。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 提供此多載的情況下，您要覆寫預設的資料分割配置。This overload is provided for scenarios where you want to override the default partitioning scheme. 例如，小型迴圈主體可能受益於資料分割的範圍。For example, small loop bodies might benefit from partitioning the range. 方法必須要有支援動態磁碟分割的自訂 partitioner。The method expects custom partitioners to support dynamic partitioning. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 < [PLINQ 和 TPL 的自訂 Partitioner](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md)並[如何： 實作動態磁碟分割](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-implement-dynamic-partitions.md)。For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md) and [How to: Implement Dynamic Partitions](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-implement-dynamic-partitions.md). `localInit`叫用委派一次參與迴圈的執行，並傳回每個這些工作的初始本機狀態每項工作。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each task that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those tasks. 這些初始狀態會傳遞至第一個`body`上每個工作引動過程。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each task. 然後，每個後續的內文引動過程傳回可能已修改的狀態值傳遞至下一個主體引動過程。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最後，在每個執行緒上的最後一個主體引動過程會傳回狀態的值傳遞至`localFinally`委派。Finally, the last body invocation on each thread returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. `localFinally`叫用委派一次每個工作，每個工作的本機狀態執行最終動作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per task to perform a final action on each task’s local state. 這個委派可能會同時叫用多個工作;因此，您必須同步處理任何共用變數的存取權。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple tasks; summary.span: 使用執行緒區域資料和 64 位元索引在 上執行 (在 Visual Basic 中為 ) 運算，其中可以平行執行反覆項目、可以設定迴圈選項，還可以監控和操作迴圈的狀態。

span.span: Executes a ( in Visual Basic) operation with thread-local data and 64-bit indexes on an in which iterations may run in parallel, loop options can be configured, and the state of the loop can be monitored and manipulated.

returns.span: 包含迴圈已完成部分之相關資訊的的結構。

span.span: A structure that contains information about which portion of the loop completed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`叫用委派一次中每個元素`source`可列舉。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each element in the `source` enumerable. 這提供下列參數： 目前的項目，可用來提早脫離迴圈的執行個體]、 [目前項目的索引 ()，和一些可能會在執行的反覆項目之間共用的本機狀態在同一執行緒中。It is provided with the following parameters: the current element, a instance that may be used to break out of the loop prematurely, the current element's index (), and some local state that may be shared amongst iterations that execute on the same thread. `localInit`叫用委派一次參與迴圈的執行，並傳回每個這些工作的初始本機狀態每項工作。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each task that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those tasks. 這些初始狀態會傳遞至第一個`body`上每個工作引動過程。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each task. 然後，每個後續的內文引動過程傳回可能已修改的狀態值傳遞至下一個主體引動過程。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最後，每個工作上上次的主體引動過程會傳回傳遞至狀態值`localFinally`委派。Finally, the last body invocation on each task returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. `localFinally`叫用委派一次每個執行緒上每個工作的本機狀態執行最終動作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per thread to perform a final action on each task’s local state. 這個委派可能會同時叫用多個工作;因此，您必須同步處理任何共用變數的存取權。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple tasks; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 方法可能會使用更多的工作，比執行緒存留時間內執行，為現有的工作完成，並由新的工作所取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 這可讓基礎物件有機會新增、 變更或移除服務迴圈的執行緒。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `body`叫用委派一次中每個元素`source`可列舉。The `body` delegate is invoked once for each element in the `source` enumerable. 這提供下列參數： 目前的項目，可用來提前結束，脫離迴圈的執行個體，且可能在相同執行緒執行的反覆項目之間共用某些本機狀態。It is provided with the following parameters: the current element, a instance that may be used to break out of the loop prematurely, and some local state that may be shared amongst iterations that execute on the same thread. `localInit`叫用委派一次參與迴圈的執行，並傳回每個這些工作的初始本機狀態每項工作。The `localInit` delegate is invoked once for each task that participates in the loop's execution and returns the initial local state for each of those tasks. 這些初始狀態會傳遞至第一個`body`上每個工作引動過程。These initial states are passed to the first `body` invocations on each task. 然後，每個後續的內文引動過程傳回可能已修改的狀態值傳遞至下一個主體引動過程。Then, every subsequent body invocation returns a possibly modified state value that is passed to the next body invocation. 最後，每個工作上上次的主體引動過程會傳回傳遞至狀態值`localFinally`委派。Finally, the last body invocation on each task returns a state value that is passed to the `localFinally` delegate. `localFinally`叫用委派一次每個執行緒上每個工作的本機狀態執行最終動作。The `localFinally` delegate is invoked once per thread to perform a final action on each task’s local state. 這個委派可能會同時叫用多個工作;因此，您必須同步處理任何共用變數的存取權。This delegate might be invoked concurrently on multiple tasks; therefore, you must synchronize access to any shared variables. 方法可能會使用更多的工作，比執行緒存留時間內執行，為現有的工作完成，並由新的工作所取代。The method may use more tasks than threads over the lifetime of its execution, as existing tasks complete and are replaced by new tasks. 這可讓基礎物件有機會新增、 變更或移除服務迴圈的執行緒。This gives the underlying object the chance to add, change, or remove threads that service the loop.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法可用來平行執行一組作業，有可能。This method can be used to execute a set of operations, potentially in parallel. 不保證會執行作業，或它們是否以平行方式執行的順序。No guarantees are made about the order in which the operations execute or whether they execute in parallel. 這個方法不會傳回每個提供的作業完成之前，不論是否完成發生一般的或異常終止。This method does not return until each of the provided operations has completed, regardless of whether completion occurs due to normal or exceptional termination. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[如何：使用 Parallel.Invoke 來執行平行作業](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-use-parallel-invoke-to-execute-parallel-operations.md)。For more information, see [How to: Use Parallel.Invoke to Execute Parallel Operations](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-use-parallel-invoke-to-execute-parallel-operations.md). ## Examples 此範例示範如何使用與其他的方法、 匿名的委派和 lambda 運算式的方法。This example demonstrates how to use the method with other methods, anonymous delegates, and lambda expressions. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法可用來平行執行一組作業，有可能。This method can be used to execute a set of operations, potentially in parallel. 取消語彙基元傳遞入結構可讓呼叫端若要取消整個作業。The cancellation token passed in with the structure enables the caller to cancel the entire operation. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[受控執行緒中的取消作業](~/docs/standard/threading/cancellation-in-managed-threads.md)。For more information, see [Cancellation in Managed Threads](~/docs/standard/threading/cancellation-in-managed-threads.md). 不保證會執行作業，或它們是否以平行方式執行的順序。No guarantees are made about the order in which the operations execute or whether they execute in parallel. 這個方法不會傳回每個提供的作業完成之前，不論是否完成發生一般的或異常終止。This method does not return until each of the provided operations has completed, regardless of whether completion occurs due to normal or exceptional termination. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[如何：使用 Parallel.Invoke 來執行平行作業](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-use-parallel-invoke-to-execute-parallel-operations.md)。For more information, see [How to: Use Parallel.Invoke to Execute Parallel Operations](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-use-parallel-invoke-to-execute-parallel-operations.md).
